intro: Acetosella clandestina, commonly known as the spring beauty, is a small, herbaceous perennial plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are usually pink or white, with five petals. Acetosella clandestina thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky slopes. It is also known for its ability to spread through rhizomes, forming dense mats in suitable habitats.
